content: Does someone know where it is specified what the extcodehash of each precompiled contract should be?

author: xrchz
content: From what I can tell the python execution specs say to treat them all as having empty code, but geth seems to treat some like that and others like they should have extcodehash of zero

author: _shemnon
content: On mainnet every precompile has a balance.  After the shanghai attacks 1 wei was transferred in to all the potential precompiles so they woudln't be regarded as "empty accounts."  Empty accounts (zero balance, zero length code, and zero nonce) have a hash of zero.  So in the the case of precompiles on mainnet as they are no longer empty accounts as they have a balance, their code is a zero length byte array, and the hash of a zero length byte array is `0xc5d2460186f7233c927e7db2dcc703c0e500b653ca82273b7bfad8045d85a470`
